title: Linux import Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the import command in Linux, learn how to import data from CSV files and Excel spreadsheets into database tables, and gain practical experience with this versatile utility.

meta.title: Linux import Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the import command in Linux, learn how to import data from CSV files and Excel spreadsheets into database tables, and gain practical experience with this versatile utility.
meta.keywords: Linux, import, CSV, Excel, database, data import, command-line, utility

steps.title: Understand the Purpose and Syntax of the import Command

verify.name: Verify the import command syntax
verify.hint: Make sure the import command is installed and the manual page contains the expected information about capturing the X server screen.

steps.title: Import Data from a CSV File into a Database Table

verify.name: Verify the CSV data import
verify.hint: Make sure the data.csv file exists in the ~/project directory and the data has been imported correctly into the users table in the sample.db database.

steps.title: Import Data from an Excel Spreadsheet into a Database Table

verify.name: Verify the Excel data import
verify.hint: Make sure the data.xlsx file exists in the ~/project directory, the xlsx2csv tool is installed, and the data has been imported correctly into the users table in the sample.db database.
